title: Riot Remember Righteous Glory?
body:
That item you nerfed to the ground and than no one ever built again? 

I think it's about time to give it another looking at

Catalyst is a Mana sustain item. If you're buying it to replace Spellvamp you're doing something wrong. 

Also, a lot of the Tanks who buy it actually do have a high mana expenditure. Blitzcrank wants it to keep his Mana up for his Shield. Amumu has always had Mana problems in drawn-out fights. Maokai wants the Mana to keep his ult up. Alistar wants it to spam his spells and heal. Hecarim wants to spam his Q.

> [{quoted}](name=Illâoi,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EzoWpdKv,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2016-07-01T08:03:58.251+0000)
>
> Catalyst is a Mana sustain item. If you're buying it to replace Spellvamp you're doing something wrong.

On Ryze,

8hp per overload, 12-15 hp per Rune Prison, 12-15hp per Spell Flux
level 9 Ryze with 900 bonus mana and 100 AP (pretty optimistic)
Overload: 300 damage
Runic Prison: 180 damage
Spell Flux: 140 damage (AoE)
Functionally equivalent to 2.7% spellvamp on Overload, 7.8% spellvamp on runic prison, and 30% spellvamp on Spell Flux.

The Catalyst effect has a big sustain boost for both health and mana, often generating more health than the old Catalyst even early on before level ups start becoming less common.

These equivalent values decrease drastically as the game progresses. Aeons might give you the early game sustain Protector gave, but it can't make up for Spellvamp. When buying Aeons on any champion, you should instead consider if you need it to sustain your Mana.

You said the item wouldn't hold any merit on Tanks because it doesn't offer much Health sustain due to their low Mana expenditure and in comparison to the damage they have to deal with.

I told you that falls off late game, which you also said in your first comment.  

The point is: Righteous Glory is great for mana sustain, has a bit of Health sustain in the early to mid game, and a great active for a lot of champions.

Righteous Glory is awesome now thanks to the Eternity passive? 

It's a NICHE item, no buffs needed.  

Edit: Scratch that. It actually has a pretty high pick rate on Tank Supports.
It may be good on certain champions (tank supports) but they mainly buy it for the MS active. The active isn't even *that* good because it only applies when going towards turrets and champions.

It's also great on Juggernauts, Tanks, and Junglers. It has an offensive part that allows you to reposition yourself quickly in a fight or engage one, and it has a "defensive" part that keeps your Health and Mana up when trading. It also gives you practically infinite Mana during fights. 

I don't see what why you would want to buff that.

I'll be honest here.

I completely forgot about this item.
Like had to take a good moment, to remind myself what it was, after seeing the topic.
Yes because it was fun when Thresh used RG active + mobis with his team for 600 MS to hook you out of nowhere and annihilate you.

RG's issue is that it has a to powerfull active **and** to niche active.
As a result, the stats it gives are horrific else we would be to powerfull. 
But with the horrific stats, it's generally a weak item unless you can make the most out of the active.
The big porblem now is that the active mostly allows you to start fights, to dive the backline. However, that only is usefull if you can win the fight you start, if you can get anything meaningfull done within their backline, and for that you do need combat stats.
As a result, the poor stats it gives prevent you from finding good oportunities for useing the active, which would be required to offset the poor stats, thus it's only usefull if you(your team) is far enough ahead that all you want is starting fights as you already have enough combat stats to win them.

So imo what should ne done is nerfing the active and ad better stats.
Change the slow from 80 for 2 sec to 75 decaying over 2 sec, lower the ms buff from 75% to 40 or even less, and **increase the health to 600-700**, if needed increrase the costs a bit aswell.
It would also be nice to seel the captains enchant on it, though that again would add niche power at the cost of consistent stats.
